qas.question: What besides sick people are antibiotics used for?
When was resistance first discussed as a problem in the raising of farm animals?
When did a district court order the FDA to stop approving antibiotics in animals?
What besides sick people are bacterial strains used for?
When was resistance first discussed as a problem in the raising of the United States?

plausible_answers.text: approvals for the use of antibiotics in livestock

qas.question: What violated Natural Resources Defense Council regulations?

plausible_answers.text: the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York

qas.question: Who ordered the FDA to use antibiotics?

context: There has been extensive use of antibiotics in <a0_0><b3_0>animal husbandry<b3_0/><a0_0/>. In the United States, the question of emergence of antibiotic-resistant bacterial strains due to use of antibiotics in livestock was raised by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in <a1_0><b4_0>1977<b4_0/><a1_0/>. In <a2_0><b5_0>March 2012<b5_0/><a2_0/>, <b7_0>the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York<b7_0/>, ruling in an action brought by the Natural Resources Defense Council and others, ordered the FDA to revoke <b6_0>approvals for the use of antibiotics in livestock<b6_0/>, which violated FDA regulations.
